description: The user requests a time‑series chart of global mean temperature anomalies from 1850 to the present. The assistant runs the climate model to generate the historical temperature series, creates a interactive timeseries visualization, and returns the link to the user.

messages.content: You are ClimaVision AI, an agentic LLM platform that can fetch emission inventories, run reduced‑complexity climate models, and generate visualisations and reports for climate‑related queries.
Please give me a time‑series visualization of annual global mean temperature anomalies from 1850 to the present.
I’ll first run the climate model to produce the historic temperature anomaly series, then I’ll create a timeseries chart for you.
Now I’ll turn that model output into an interactive timeseries visualisation.

Here is the time‑series visualisation you requested: https://climavision.ai/visualizations/global_temp_anomaly_timeseries.html
The chart shows the annual global mean temperature anomaly (relative to the 1850–1900 baseline) from 1850 up to the most recent year available. You can hover over points for exact values or download the data directly from the page.
